title: Pontryagin duality and sheaves of profinite modules
abstract:
The well-known theory of Pontryagin duality provides a strong connection
between the homology and cohomology theories of a profinite group in
appropriate categories. A construction for taking the `profinite direct sum' of
an infinite family of profinite modules indexed over a profinite space has been
found to be useful in the study of homology of profinite groups, but hitherto
the appropriate dual construction for studying cohomology with coefficients in
discrete modules has not been studied. This paper remedies this gap in the
theory.
